com.java.model.player

Class BenevolentModeTest

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.java.model.player.BenevolentModeTest

  • public class BenevolentModeTest
extends java.lang.Object
    This class test the benevolent strategy behavior. reinforce - its weaker country. attack - never attacks. fortify - weaker countries.
    Version:
    3.0.0
    Author:
    Arnav Bhardwaj, Karan Dhingra, Ghalia Elkerdi, Sahil Singh Sodhi, Cristian Rodriguez

    • Method Detail

      • setUp

        public static void setUp()
        Sets up the scenario for the tests. Creates a map, two players, a human and a Benevolent.

      • testCalculateReinforcement

        public void testCalculateReinforcement()
        Tests the received number of armies from reinforcement.

      • testCalculateReinforcementWithConqueredContinent

        public void testCalculateReinforcementWithConqueredContinent()
        Tests the received number of armies from reinforcement.

      • testAttack

        public void testAttack()
        Verify there is no attack in benevolent mode. The number of armies before and after calling the attack method should be the same.

      • testCalculateFortificationPaths

        public void testCalculateFortificationPaths()
        Test the fortification benevolent strategy.

      • testCalculateReinforcementArmyFromValidTradeCards

        public void testCalculateReinforcementArmyFromValidTradeCards()
        Calculate reinforcement army for a player with three cards in hand. The trade is automatic.
